content: Mark, this is one of your best pieces — and that’s saying a lot! I’ve looked at the whole journey of starting my company in retrospect. Pre-funding, series A, B, C. I think I was not even fully aware of what I was doing before series A. Then A happened, and it was incredibly validating. The speaking, the traveling, the TV/Radio/Podcast shows. By virtue of the A everyone assumes you know what you are doing; they listen. You almost need this momentum to get you through the next phase, when competitors start to grow, and you are not the darling. I don’t think I even cracked open a spreadsheet until Series B. But the trick is to remain positive and have almost-delusional feelings of greatness while knowing when you are about to get your ass kicked. By Series C I felt I had to truly earn it. I had to manufacture that vision. I’m like you. I have unbelievable visions while hiking, driving, etc. I’m talking insane shit — the latest one involves immersive, AR-powered movie making, levitation and device-free viewing (leaving the viewing mechanism to myself). All this from a non-techie Media Geek. But if we don’t have our visions, forget this line of work.
